Key Match Events: Julian Alvarez scored the second-half goal spurred by a through ball from Messi to Alexis Mac Allister
Lautaro Martinez sealed the outcome in the 89th minute with an assist from Messi
Post-Match Reflections: Argentina had to take its punches and fight through its misses to secure a 2-0 win over Canada
Canada head coach Jesse Marsch addressed the halftime delay after the game
Miscellaneous Highlights: The path through an international tournament is rarely an easy one
Both teams will pull something positive out of this game, whether it be Canada’s fight or Argentina’s ability to get a result despite lacking lethality in big moments
Others: Argentina wasn’t sluggish in the first half, but they were cautious at times
Maxime Crepeau made several important saves for Canada
Canada’s midblock forced Argentina to swing the ball laterally
Spaces opened up, but when they switched to Di Maria on the right, or to Marcos Acuña on the left, Argentina rarely took that chance
Argentina delayed their return to the pitch after halftime
Canada waited patiently on the pitch
Argentina delayed their return to the pitch after halftime, as Canada waited patiently on the pitch
It appeared as if midfielder Leandro Paredes and defender Cristian Romero knew that Di Maria wouldn’t outrun Alphonso Davies
Argentina’s respect for Canada’s speed in transition resulted in fairly conservative play from the world champions
Missed chances from Messi, Di Maria and Mac Allister kept the first 45 minutes even in Atlanta
Both teams had their chances throughout the match
Did Argentina need some halftime mind games to overcome Canada?
